newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spanish firms to pay 75 bln pta to update accounts.
newsitem.headline: Spanish firms to pay 75 bln pta to update accounts.

text.p: Spain's Secretary of State for the Exchequer Juan Costa on Tuesday said the government expected to earn 75 billion pesetas from the updating of company balance sheets during the first year the measure was applied.

Costa estimated revenue of 150 billion pesetas from the three percent tax linked to the updating of balance sheets. This would be counteracted by a drop in revenue of 75 billion due to an increase in amortisations.
The end result would be 75 billion peseta increase in revenues in the first year, he concluded. This was a cautious estimate, Costa told parliament's Economy Commission.
